qas.question: As a child, Athanasius imitated what ritual?
Why was Athanasius instructed to stop pretend baptising?
What work did the Bishop suggest for Athanasius?
When Rufinus stood by a window what did he witness?
Who told Rufinus that the baptisms were genuine?
As an adult, Athanasius imitated what ritual?
Why was Athanasius ordered to continue baptising?
What school did the Bishop suggest for Athanasius?

context: Rufinus relates a story that as Bishop Alexander stood by a window, he watched boys playing on the seashore below, imitating <b4_0>the <a0_0><b8_0>ritual of Christian baptism<b8_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/>. He sent for the children and discovered that one of the boys (<b5_0>Athanasius<b5_0/>) had acted as bishop. After questioning Athanasius, <b6_0>Bishop Alexander<b6_0/> informed him that <a1_0>the baptisms were genuine<a1_0/>, as both the form and matter of the sacrament had been performed through the recitation of the correct words and the administration of water, and that he must not continue to do this as those baptized had <a2_0><b9_0>not been properly catechized<b9_0/><a2_0/>. He invited Athanasius and his playfellows to prepare for <a3_0><b7_0><b10_0>clerical<b10_0/><b7_0/> careers<a3_0/>.
